Title: [Updated] Drilling Engineering and Technical Services Market Size Analysis | Jereh Oilfield Services Group, ZPEC ... - economica.ma
Summary: The report offers comprehensive insights and intelligence on the global Drilling Engineering and Technical Services Market from 2024 to 2031. Key insights include market trends, pricing, geographical regions, technology, supply and demand dynamics, and competitive landscape analysis. The report aims to facilitate sustainable growth by providing a thorough market analysis, including a five forces analysis, SWOT analysis, and investment feasibility assessment. Major players like Sinopec, CNOOC, Schlumberger, and Baker Hughes are highlighted.

Title: Norway's high rate of exploration continues with fresh approvals for new wells - Upstream Online
Summary: Norway continues its high rate of exploration with new approvals for nearly 40 exploration wells this year. This activity is significant for the global oil market and highlights Norway's robust exploration efforts. Companies like Equinor and Aker BP are key players in these initiatives.

Title: Nicola Mining Announces Completion of 3D IP Survey and Commencement of Exploration Drilling at the New ... - Newsfile
Summary: Nicola Mining completed a 3D induced polarization survey and commenced its 2024 diamond drilling program at the New Craigmont Copper Project. The survey defined two principal exploration areas, identifying significant resistivity and chargeability anomalies. The initial drilling will focus on the West Craigmont Zone, with plans for 5,000 meters of core drilling.

Title: Rig arrives in Canada ready to launch key exploration campaign - Upstream Online
Summary: The Hercules semisub drilling rig has arrived in Bay Bulls, Newfoundland & Labrador, Canada, to drill two wells for Equinor. This marks the beginning of a significant exploration campaign in the region, demonstrating ongoing investments in oil exploration.

Title: Exploration Co. Announces MRE & 2024 Drilling Program - Streetwise Reports
Summary: Metallic Minerals Corp. announced its maiden NI 43-101 mineral resource estimate (MRE) at the Keno Silver project and the initiation of its 2024 drilling program. The MRE includes an inferred resource of 2.5 Mt at 223 g/t AgEq, equating to 18.16 Moz of contained AgEq. The 2024 drilling program aims to expand existing resources and explore new targets.

Title: Sitka Expands Exploration Program at its RC Gold Project in Yukon to Include Drilling and Surface Work on the Newly ... - StockTitan
Summary: Sitka Gold has expanded its 2024 exploration program at the RC Gold Project to include diamond drilling and additional geochemical surveys, geological mapping, and data integration. The first diamond drilling at the Rhosgobel Intrusion since 1995 aims to extend historical gold findings. The program targets multiple high-potential gold zones.

Title: ExxonMobil lands promising pair of exploration blocks in North Africa - Upstream Online
Summary: ExxonMobil has secured two promising exploration blocks in shallow water offshore Morocco. The company aims to assess the oil and gas potential of these blocks, highlighting ongoing interest and investment in North African exploration.

Title: Forge Resources Advances Exploration with Successful Drilling and Funding - TipRanks.com - TipRanks
Summary: Forge Resources reported successful drilling results and secured funding to advance its exploration efforts. The company's activities underscore the importance of continued investment in exploration to identify new resource opportunities.

Title: Ambitious junior finalises licences for two promising Caribbean exploration blocks - Upstream Online
Summary: Touchstone Exploration has completed the acquisition of licences for two onshore exploration blocks in Trinidad & Tobago. This expansion reflects the company's strategic efforts to enhance its exploration portfolio in the Caribbean.

Title: ADNOC Drilling secures $733 million in offshore drilling contracts for massive Zakum oil field - WorldOil
Summary: ADNOC Drilling has secured $733 million in contracts for three island drilling rigs to support operations at the offshore Zakum oil field. The rigs, incorporating advanced technology and automation, will be delivered by 2026. This move is part of ADNOC's strategy to boost efficiency and production capacity.
